User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the BookItEasy application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

role.description: The user's role within the application (e.g., 'client', 'admin', 'staff').

Appointment.title: Appointment
Appointment.description: Represents an appointment booked by a client.

id.description: Unique identifier for the appointment entity.

clientId.description: The ID of the client who booked the appointment.

services.description: An array of services booked for the appointment.

totalPrice.description: The total price of all services in the appointment.

totalDuration.description: The total duration of all services in the appointment in minutes.

date.description: The date of the appointment in 'MMM d, yyyy' format.

barberId.description: The ID of the requested barber.

notes.description: Optional notes from the client for the barber.

paymentStatus.description: The payment status of the appointment.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the appointment was created.

bookedBy.description: The name of the admin or staff member who manually created the booking.

Service.title: Service
Service.description: Represents a service or package offered by the barber shop.

isPackage.description: True if this is a package deal.

duration.description: The duration of the service in minutes.

description.description: A short description of the service.

enabled.description: Whether the service is available for booking.

Barber.title: Barber
Barber.description: Represents a barber available for appointments.

name.description: The name or description of the expense (e.g., 'Shop Rent', 'Staff Lunch').

createdAt.description: The date the expense was incurred.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support a simple appointment booking system with user authentication and role management. It prioritizes security and scalability by adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence and Structural Segregation. The structure uses path-based ownership for user-specific data (appointments) and separates user profiles from appointment data to simplify security rules and ensure data integrity. This design avoids using `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations and easier debugging. The `services` and `barbers` collections are top-level collections for easy querying and management by admins.

Authorization Independence:
Appointments are stored under `/users/{userId}/appointments/{appointmentId}`, which allows direct ownership-based security rules without needing to fetch parent user data. The `clientId` field in the `Appointment` document is redundant but is kept to make querying for a specific client's appointments easier, if necessary, at the cost of data duplication.

QAPs Support:
The structure supports QAPs (Rules are not Filters) effectively. List operations for appointments are scoped to the user's path (`/users/{userId}/appointments`), enabling secure listing of appointments associated with a specific user. The 'users' collection is segregated from the 'appointments' subcollection to ensure that listing users does not expose appointment data. Admins will require custom backend logic, the firestore structure is not aware of admin capabilities.
